title: Nuwara Eliya records today’s lowest temperature at 5°C
byline: The lowest temperature in Sri Lanka today (23) was recorded at the Nuwara Eliya Meteorological Station at 5.0 degrees Celsius, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Mobile lab tests reveal drug use among passenger bus drivers – Dy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister of Transport and Highways, Dr. Prasanna Gunasena, stated that 10 out of 56 bus drivers tested by the mobile laboratory service, which was launched on January 21 to identify passenger bus drivers and assistants operating under the influence of drugs, were found to have used illicit narcotics.

title: Gold tops $4,900/oz; silver and platinum extend record‑setting rally
byline: Gold pushed past $4,900 per ounce for the first time on Thursday, powered by ongoing geopolitical tensions, a softer U.S. dollar and expectations of Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, while silver and platinum prices hit fresh record highs.

title: EU wants U.S. trade deal back on track, but warns it would defend itself if threatened again
byline: EU leaders heaved a sigh of relief over Donald Trump’s U-turn on Greenland as they met for an emergency summit in Brussels late on Thursday.

title: JSC issues circular on annual salary increment criteria for Labour Tribunal Presidents
byline: The Judicial Service Commission (JSC) of Sri Lanka has issued a circular outlining the criteria for granting annual salary increments to Presidents of Labour Tribunals.

title: Showers expected in several districts today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Northern, North-central, Eastern provinces and in Matale and Nuwara-Eliya districts from today evening (23), according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: US Embassy in Colombo warns against unauthorized employment on visitor visas
byline: The U.S. Embassy in Colombo has reminded Sri Lankan travellers to ensure they comply with U.S. visa regulations before travelling to the United States.

title: China says it rescued Philippine crew from cargo ship near Scarborough Shoal
byline: The Chinese Coast Guard said on Friday it dispatched two vessels to rescue 21 Philippine crew members in a foreign cargo ship that capsized near the Scarborough Shoal in the South China Sea.

title: Another suspect arrested over Jinthupitiya shooting incident
byline: Another suspect has been arrested in connection with the shooting incident in Jinthupitiya, which resulted in the death of one person and injuries to two small children on January 16, 2026, police said.

title: GMOA to launch island-wide token strike today
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has announced that a 48-hour island-wide token strike will be carried out in hospitals from 8.00 a.m. today (23).

title: The deal to secure TikTok’s future in the US has finally closed
byline: The joint venture acquiring TikTok’s US assets has been formally established and has announced its leadership team, according to the company, one day before the deadline set by President Donald Trump for the app’s US assets to be spun off by Chinese parent company ByteDance.

title: Ubisoft eyes ‘major reset’ as ‘Prince of Persia’ remake among 6 games axed amid layoffs, studio closures
byline: Six highly awaited games have been axed at French video game developer Ubisoft, as a part of what the company calls a “major organisational, operational, and portfolio reset”.

title: Trump launches ‘Board of Peace’ at Davos signing ceremony
byline: US President Donald Trump signed the charter to formally launch his “Board of Peace” initiative in Davos on Thursday, calling it a “very exciting day, long in the making”.

title: New legislation needed to regulate Social Media promotions: Media Minister
byline: Appropriate legislation should be enacted to regulate promotions and advertisements on social media that cause distress to the public across all sectors, Minister of Mass Media Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa stated.

title: Appeals Court to review remand order in Trincomalee Buddha Statue incident
byline: The Court of Appeal today (22) ordered that the written order and audio recording of the directive issued by the Trincomalee Magistrate’s Court on 19 January pertaining to the Buddha statue incident, be produced before court without delay.

title: PM Harini holds high-level meetings with EU, UNDP and corporate leaders in Davos
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has held a series of high-level bilateral meetings on January 21 on the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, engaging with representatives of the European Union (EU), the United Nations Development Programme, and the global private sector, the PM’s Office said.

title: Taylor Swift makes history as she joins Songwriters Hall of Fame
byline: Taylor Swift has become the youngest female artist inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.

title: Suspect arrested with illegally imported cigarettes in Wellampitiya
byline: An individual has been arrested with a stock of 165,200 illegally imported cigarettes from a residence in Wellampitiya, police stated.

title: Ex-minister Ramesh Pathirana rejoins SLPP
byline: Former Minister Ramesh Pathirana has rejoined the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) and has been appointed as the party’s Benthara-Elpitiya Electoral Organiser.

title: GMOA to launch island-wide token strike tomorrow
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has announced that a 48-hour island-wide token strike will commence from 8.00 a.m. tomorrow (23).

title: Duo arrested with over 1kg of ‘Ice’ in Madampitiya
byline: Two individuals have been arrested for the possession of 1 kilogram and 501 grams of Crystal Methamphetamine (commonly known as ‘Ice’) by the Madampitiya Police.

title: Election Commission approves registration of five new political parties
byline: The National Election Commission has granted approval to register five new political parties.

title: GMOA strike in Eastern Province called off
byline: The strike launched by doctors at hospitals in the Eastern Province has been called off at 2:00 p.m. today, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has announced.

title: Heavy rains wreak havoc in New Zealand, several people missing in landslide
byline: Several people were missing following a landslide near a ⁠campsite in New Zealand’s North Island on Thursday (Jan 22), as heavy rains caused widespread damage, with homes being evacuated, thousands without power and roads closed.

title: 1,282 leprosy patients identified in Sri Lanka in 2025: Health officials
byline: A total of 1,282 leprosy patients were identified in the country in 2025, the Director of the Leprosy Eradication Campaign, Dr. Yasoma Weerasekara noted.

title: Landslide risk prompts safety measures at Soranathota Central College
byline: A soil embankment near Soranathota Central College, Badulla has been identified as being at risk of a landslide.

title: US set to quit World Health Organization
byline: The US is due to officially exit the World Health Organization on Thursday, in the face of warnings it will hit both U.S. health and global health and also in violation of a U.S. law that requires Washington to pay the U.N. health agency $260 million in fees that it owes.

title: CSE donates Rs. 25 million to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange has contributed Rs. 25 million to the Rebuilding Sri Lanka Fund, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Largest drug seizure in recent history achieved in 2025: Police
byline: The largest quantity of drugs seized by law enforcement officials in recent history was recorded in 2025, Police Media Spokesperson Assistant Superintendent of Police F. U. Wootler stated.

title: Matale Police crackdown on illegal street racing, 10 motorcycles seized
byline: Several individuals have been arrested along with 10 high-engine capacity motorcycles that were being used for illegal street racing along the Sangamitta Mawatha in Matale.

title: Doctors at National Eye Hospital to strike today over irregular transfers
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) has announced that doctors at the Colombo National Eye Hospital will commence a strike today (22) in protest against irregular staff transfers.

title: Global stocks stage dramatic rebound after Trump announces Greenland framework
byline: Global shares rebounded on Wednesday (Jan 21) from a selloff the previous session after US President Donald Trump said a framework ⁠on a future deal over Greenland has been reached.

title: Hollywood isn’t pushing unreasonably high beauty standards - Ashton Kutcher
byline: US actor Ashton Kutcher has said he believes Hollywood is not pushing unreasonably high beauty standards, adding that wider society is to blame for the increasing desire to look perfect.

title: Mainly dry weather will prevail in most parts of the island today
byline: The prevailing dry weather conditions are expected to change from tomorrow (23), the Department of Meteorology has warned.

title: Temperature in Nuwara Eliya drops to 3.5°C
byline: The lowest temperature recorded today (22) was reported in Nuwara Eliya, measuring 3.5°C, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: Four petitions filed in Supreme Court challenging Bill to abolish MPs’ pensions
byline: Four petitions have been filed before the Supreme Court challenging the Bill seeking to abolish the pension scheme for Members of Parliament.

title: Indictments filed against Arjuna Ranatunga and brother in corruption case
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has informed the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today (22) that indictments have been filed in the Colombo High Court against former Minister Arjuna Ranatunga and his brother, Dhammika Ranatunga.

title: The Eagles’ ‘Greatest Hits’ is the first album in US history to sell over 40M units
byline: Take it easy and go quadruple diamond. The Eagles’ 1976 album “Their Greatest Hits 1971-1975” the bestselling album of all time in the U.S., has officially sold over 40 million units. That’s according to new certification from the Recording Industry Association of America.

title: Oman and Indonesian naval ships arrive at Colombo Port
byline: The Royal Navy of Oman ship ‘AL SEEB’ arrived at the Port of Colombo today (22) on a logistics replenishment visit, the Sri Lanka Navy said.

title: No Cabinet discussion on removal of Attorney General – Justice Minister
byline: Minister of Justice and National Integration, Harshana Nanayakkara, stated that no discussion regarding the removal of the Attorney General took place during the Cabinet meeting.

title: SC determination on MPs’ Pension Repeal Bill to be submitted to Speaker
byline: The Supreme Court has concluded its review of the petitions filed challenging the bill submitted to Parliament for the abolition of parliamentary pensions.

title: Gem or Not? Value of suspected gemstone found in Galaha revealed
byline: The National Gem and Jewellery Authority has issued its investigative report on the suspected gemstone found in Galaha, Kandy recently.

title: Ven. Ulapane Sumangala Thero gives statement to CID over Grade 6 module
byline: Venerable Ulapane Sumangala Thero, President of the Association of Educational Professionals, has arrived at the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning (22) to provide a statement regarding the Grade 6 English language module issue.

title: Apple to revamp Siri as a built-in chatbot: Report
byline: Apple plans to revamp Siri later this year by turning the digital assistant into the company’s first artificial intelligence chatbot, Bloomberg News reported on Wednesday.

title: Three dead in shooting in Australia’s New South Wales
byline: Three people have died after a reported shooting in a small town in New South Wales, Australia, police say.

title: Government Radiological Technologists suspend strike for seven days
byline: The Government Radiological Technologists’ Association has decided to temporarily suspend the strike action that began yesterday (21) at 8.00 a.m.

title: ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund receives over Rs. 8.5B in contributions – Finance Secretary
byline: The Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma, has provided an update on the current status of the ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund, established by the government to support reconstruction efforts following Cyclone ‘Ditwah’.

title: Ragama town to be developed as health, education, and transport hub – Minister
byline: Minister of Transport, Highways, and Urban Development, Bimal Rathnayake, informed Parliament today (23) that plans have been formulated to construct a Multimodal Transport Hub centered around Ragama town.

title: Anusha Palpita arrested by Bribery Commission
byline: Former Secretary to the Ministry of Mass Media and former Chairman of the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL), Anusha Palpita, has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Former Minister Johnston Fernando and sons further remanded
byline: Five suspects including former Minister Johnston Fernando and his two sons, who were arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID), have been further remanded until January 30 by the Wattala Magistrate’s Court.

title: Trump says he’s withdrawing invitation for Carney to join his Gaza ‘Board of Peace’
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said late Thursday that he is withdrawing an invitation for Prime Minister Mark Carney to join his “Board of Peace” initiative for Gaza.

title: PM Harini returns from World Economic Forum 2026 in Davos
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, who participated in the 56th Annual Meeting of the World Economic Forum (WEF) 2026 held in Davos, Switzerland, has returned to Sri Lanka this morning (23).

title: Japan’s Takaichi dissolves parliament after only 3 months in office, setting up snap election
byline: Japan’s Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi dissolved the lower house of Parliament on Friday, paving the way for a Feb. 8 snap election.

title: Court temporarily lifts overseas travel ban on Prasanna Ranatunga
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the temporary lifting of the overseas travel ban imposed on former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga.

title: Hospital services disrupted as GMOA’s token strike gets underway
byline: The 48-hour token strike launched by the Government Medical Officers Association (GMOA) based on several demands is currently underway.

title: Indictments filed against former Minister Chamara Sampath
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has informed the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court today (23) that indictments have been filed in the Colombo High Court against former Minister Chamara Sampath Dassanayake over a corruption allegation.

title: Third berth at Colombo Port’s ECT enters service
byline: The Colombo East Container Terminal of the Sri Lanka Ports Authority marked a pivotal operational milestone today (23) with the commissioning of its third berth at the Port of Colombo, the Sri Lanka Ports Authority said.

title: New circular issued on restoring livelihoods of cyclone-affected communities
byline: A new circular has been issued to facilitate the restoration of livelihoods of the people impacted by the disaster caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Sri Lanka’s Hatton among National Geographic’s top gourmet stays to book in 2026
byline: Sri Lanka’s iconic tea heritage has been highlighted by National Geographic Traveller (UK) as part of a global feature on food-focused travel experiences around the world.

title: Harry Styles announces global tour dates with 30 nights in New York City
byline: Harry Styles is officially getting ready for a seven-city residency, with the singer announcing his upcoming world tour, Together Together, on Thursday via Instagram.

title: Anusha Palpita remanded
byline: Former Secretary to the Ministry of Mass Media and former Chairman of the Telecommunications Regulatory Commission of Sri Lanka (TRCSL), Anusha Palpita, has been remanded until February 6 by the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court.

title: Karu Jayasuriya writes to President over abolition of MPs’ Pensions
byline: Former Speaker of Parliament Karu Jayasuriya has directed a letter to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake regarding the abolition of pensions for Members of Parliament.

title: CAASL to introduce licensing system for drone pilots for first time in Sri Lanka
byline: For the first time, the Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka (CAASL) is set to introduce a licensing system for Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) operators engaged in commercial and professional activities.

title: CSD members donate day’s salary to ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund
byline: The members of the Civil Security Department have donated a day’s salary to the ‘Rebuilding Sri Lanka’ Fund, which was established to restore livelihoods and rebuild the country following the devastation caused by cyclone Ditwah, the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: AI could be smarter than all of humanity in five years, says Elon Musk
byline: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said artificial intelligence (AI) is on track to become smarter than all of humanity combined within the next five years — a shift he believes will change how people work, move and even find purpose.

title: Ex-President Ranil calls on Malwathu and Asgiriya Chief Prelates
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has visited the Chief Prelates of the Malwathu and Asgiriya Buddhist Chapters and received their blessings, this morning (23).

title: US completes withdrawal from World Health Organisation
byline: The US has finalised its withdrawal from the World Health Organisation, one year after President Donald Trump announced America was ending its 78-year-old commitment, federal officials said Thursday. But it’s hardly a clean break.

title: CEB restructuring process to continue further
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has announced that the restructuring process will continue further and has reached the final stage.

title: “We are ready to step down when people decide on a change” - PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, stated she is prepared to step down from the position of Prime Minister once the people of the country decide that a change is necessary.

title: Rare Sri Lankan leopard gives birth to 3 cubs in Singapore Zoo
byline: Three Sri Lankan leopard cubs were born in the Singapore Zoo on January 1, bringing the population of the rare animal in Mandai Wildlife Reserve to seven.

title: Indian specialist medical team arrives in Sri Lanka to assist Cyclone Ditwah victims
byline: A team of five specialist doctors from the Indian state of Kerala have arrived in Sri Lanka today (23) to provide essential medical services to people affected by Cyclone Ditwah, who are currently staying at “Suraksha” relief camps in the Badulla District.

title: Govt. focused on providing pension for private, semi-govt workers: Dy Minister
byline: The government has focused on providing a pension to the employees in the private sector and the semi-government sector, Deputy Minister of Labor Mahinda Jayasinghe said.

title: Trump says US ‘armada’ heading toward Iran
byline: President Donald Trump said on Thursday that the United States has an “armada” heading toward Iran but hoped he would not have to use it, as he renewed warnings to Tehran against killing protesters or restarting its nuclear program.

title: 480 arrested for drug driving so far this year – Public Security Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala stated that 480 motorists found to be driving under the influence of narcotic substances have been arrested during the first 22 days of this year.

title: Universities (Amendments) Bill passed with amendments in Parliament
byline: The Universities (Amendments) Bill has been passed in Parliament with amendments, following its third reading, the Speaker of the House Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne announced.

title: PM and Opp. Leader agree on civil society reps to Constitutional Council
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya and Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa have agreed on the appointments of civil society representatives to the Constitutional Council (CC).

title: Sri Lankan arrested for facilitating friend’s visit to UK on his visa, boarding pass
byline: A Sri Lankan-origin UK national has been arrested by the Kempegowda International Airport (KIA) police for allegedly facilitating another person’s travel to the UK with his visa and boarding pass. The accused, Kandiya Rajagopal, had given his visa and boarding pass to his friend Sharushan Kunasekaran, who used them to travel to the UK.

title: Sri Lanka Embassy in Doha recovers over Rs. 197 million in compensation in 2025
byline: The Embassy of Sri Lanka in Doha has recovered a total of Rs. 197,719,710.36 in 2025 as compensation on behalf of the Next of Kins (NOKs) of Sri Lankan nationals who had passed away in Qatar, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: Two fishing boats seized with 270 kg of ‘Ice’ and heroin off southern coast
byline: Two multi-day fishing trawlers transporting a large haul of drugs in the deep seas off the southern coast have been taken into custody during a joint operation by the Sri Lanka Navy and Police Narcotics Bureau (PNB).

title: First Technology Service and Support Centre opens at Vavuniya University
byline: The first Technology Service and Support Centre of the Ministry of Science and Technology was officially inaugurated today (23) at the University of Vavuniya.
